head.title: Top Bridge Teams Escape Defeat At Tournament

hedline.hl1: Top Bridge Teams Escape Defeat At Tournament

abstract.p: Two top-ranked teams, in danger of defeat, survive in Women's Knockout Teams at American Contract Bridge League's Summer Nationals in Anaheim, Calif (S)

block.p: Two top-ranked teams were in danger of defeat but survived in the Women's Knockout Teams at the American Contract Bridge League's Summer Nationals here on Wednesday night.

The top-seeded foursome -- Connie Goldberg of Merion Station, Pa.; Rozanne Pollack of Warren, N.J.; Lynn Deas of Schenectady, N.Y.; and Beth Palmer of Silver Spring, Md. -- trailed by 10 imps into the final segment of their quarterfinal match but gained a victory by 8 against a group led by Beverly Rosenberg of Sherman Oaks, Calif.
Two top-ranked teams were in danger of defeat but survived in the Women's Knockout Teams at the American Contract Bridge League's Summer Nationals here on Wednesday night.

The top-seeded foursome -- Connie Goldberg of Merion Station, Pa.; Rozanne Pollack of Warren, N.J.; Lynn Deas of Schenectady, N.Y.; and Beth Palmer of Silver Spring, Md. -- trailed by 10 imps into the final segment of their quarterfinal match but gained a victory by 8 against a group led by Beverly Rosenberg of Sherman Oaks, Calif.

In another match Kathie Wei-Sender of Nashville; Betty Ann Kennedy of Shreveport, La.; Jill Levin of Riverdale, the Bronx; Juanita Chambers of Walpole, Mass.; Janice Seamon-Molson of Miami; and Tobi Sokolow of Austin, Tex., trailed by 5 going into the final quarter but surged to win by 48 against Jean Hume of Livermore, Calif., and her team.

Joan Jackson of Dallas heads a Texas team that will represent the United States at the world championships in the Netherlands later this month. That squad won by 74 against Jan Martel of Davis, Calif., and her team. A group led by Cheri Bjerkan of Elmhurst, Ill., withstood a late charge by Lynn Baker of Austin and her team to win by 15.
In semifinal play today, Goldberg faced Jackson and Wei-Sender faced Bjerkan.
